summary: The Drug Enforcement Administration collects industry-reported data on the sale and purchase of controlled substances and prescription drugs, including opioids. The data supports DEA’s investigations into whether drugs have been diverted to the illegal marketplace. DEA’s systems don’t provide real-time analysis, but more robust analysis is possible. title: Drug Control: Actions Needed to Ensure Usefulness of Data on Suspicious Opioid Orders
